FAQs about the Champions League final
What’s at stake?
Manchester City would complete a historic treble if they beat Inter Milan. It would also be the first time they have won the competition in their history.
As for Inter Milan, as mentioned, it is a chance for them to lift their first Champions League title since 2010.
Who are the favourites?
Manchester City are currently 2/9 favourites to win the game, according to Oddschecker.
Pep Guardiola’s side beat RB Leipzig, Bayern Munich and Real Madrid in the knockout stages to reach the final.
Inter, on the other hand, defeated Porto, Benfica, and their rivals – AC Milan.
When is the Champions League final?
The final will take place at 8pm UK time on Saturday the 10th of June. The match is being held at the Atatürk Olympic Stadium in Istanbul.
Who has won the most Champions Leagues?
Real Madrid have won by far the most Champions League titles, with 14. They are also the reigning champions.
They are followed most closely by AC Milan (7), Liverpool (6), Bayern Munich (6) and Barcelona (5).
Now, you could watch Man City win the competition for the first time with ExpressVPN!
How much do clubs get for winning the Champions League?
The prize money for competing in the Champions League varies depending on how you have performed in the competition.
Last season, champions Real Madrid collected €83.2m (£71.6m) in Champions League performance-based prize money.
This season, winning the entire competition with a perfect group-stage performance would earn a maximum prize money payout of €85.1m (£73.3)
Neither Man City nor Inter Milan, this year’s finalists, managed to win all their group games.
But, the winner of the competition will be guaranteed a lump sum of €20m (£17.2m), while the runner-up will receive €15.5m (£13.3m)
